column4: or you mean exif viewer? I think shotwell(gnome) can view exif, try others also, gimp, gpicview, gqview
if you know when the image was generated originally, then, exif records the modification time as well.
how about gimp , inkscape, will they show that information ?
but if the student knows about exif, he/she probably can modify it to fake the origin as well
is exif more special than gimp or inkscape ?
exif is quite old, so I suppose many software support it, but I have no experience myself
no, exif is part of image file format
yes, just check shotwell and gqview shows exif info
how to view exif info in dqview ?
gqview, choose View->Exif WIndow, it generates more numbers, to get it more human readable try: shotwell View->Exif Info
shotwell : view => fullScreen ; just has that option
have you imported your photos first in shotwell?
then, click a photo first, and click 'View' -> 'Extended Information'
I think shotwell arranges photos by date :) and display photo time at the left bottom corner
if you see the modified time be later, it's a clear sign of manipulation, however, the time can be easily reset to whatever, if the user knows exif
try this one: sudo apt-get install mapivi , I think it's enough for forensic purposes
